post.body:
Hello, I have my ZeroNet running on a Server for running 24/7. Accessing it over VPN like myserver:43110. So I run into the Problem, that links like 127.0.0.1:43110/address do not work.
Please use links like href="/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D" in your sites.
Thank you.

I have set up a private proxy like in the video: http://myserver:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1545756812_12Y8rPJTMwJ3tTh5j81JPy6HrMf4KvY6Uq
But I still have problem with links, which are pointing to http://127.0.0.1:43110/. Is there a solution? (I wouldn't like to install a firefox-plugin to my tor-browser)
And by the way, is there any documentation to the function of the plugins of ZeroNet?

comment.body: @Klu9: I did get it on F-Droid (all repos activated and Android >8). Even running behind the Ordroid VPN Proxy. Worked perfectly.
@Klu9: Sorry: I really thought I had it installed via F-Droid. I might have been wrong, because I didnt find it now too.
@Klu9: I used this one (clearnet): https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-kivy/releases/tag/v0.6.3.4 It is the same Repository/Person as ZeroNet itself.
@→_→: just been running it on Huawei P20pro with Android Pie (9). ZeroNet Version 0.6.3.3
